Text: [Cybersecurity] Security controls are classified by implementation as {{c1::managerial::category}}, {{c2::operational::category}}, {{c3::technical::category}}, and {{c4::physical::category}}.
Extra:
Based on how they are applied.
Rationale: Tests recall of the four implementation categories of security controls in a structured enumeration
Metadata: Multiple-cloze
Source: Section::1.2

Text: [Cybersecurity] Security controls are classified by function as {{c1::preventive::type}}, {{c2::detective::type}}, {{c3::corrective::type}}, {{c4::deterrent::type}}, {{c5::compensating::type}}, and {{c6::directive::type}}.
Extra:
Based on their role in incident management.
Rationale: Tests recall of the six functional types of security controls in a structured enumeration
Metadata: Multiple-cloze

Text: [Cybersecurity] Access control lists (ACLs) determine {{c1::access permissions::function}} for {{c2::subjects::entity}} to {{c3::resources::target}}.
Extra:
Core security mechanism.
Rationale: Tests recall of the key function, entity, and target of access control lists in a concise, atomic format
Metadata: Multiple-cloze
Source: Section::1.2

Text: [Cybersecurity] The {{c1::Chief Security Officer (CSO)::role}} is responsible for {{c2::information assurance::function}} and {{c3::systems security::function}}.
Extra:
Key organizational role.
Rationale: Tests recall of the CSO’s title and its two primary responsibilities in a concise, atomic format
Metadata: Multiple-cloze
Source: Section::1.2

Text: [Cybersecurity] Preventive controls aim to {{c1::eliminate or reduce::action or action}} the likelihood of a {{c2::successful attack::outcome}}.
Extra:
Core preventive function.
Rationale: Tests recall of the key purpose and outcome of preventive controls in a concise, atomic format

Key organizational role.

Text: [Cybersecurity] The {{c1::Chief Technology Officer (CTO)::role}} focuses on effective use of {{c2::new computing platforms::resource}}.
